alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 27 at 2:16AM ChST until January 28 at 6:00PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CHST THIS AFTERNOON ALONG NORTH AND WEST FACING REEFS... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 6 PM CHST SATURDAY ALONG NORTH AND WEST FACING REEFS... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CHST SATURDAY ALONG EAST FACING REEFS... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON ALONG NORTH, WEST, AND EAST FACING REEFS... * WHAT...For the High Surf Warning, dangerously large breaking waves of 11 to 16 feet in the surf zone. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 8 to 13 feet expected in the surf zone. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...For North and West facing reefs, High Surf Warning until 2pm Friday, then a High Surf Advisory until 6pm Saturday. For East facing reefs, High Surf Advisory. Dangerous rip currents for north, west and east facing reefs. * WHEN...For the High Surf Warning, until 2 PM ChST this afternoon. For the High Surf Advisory, until 6 PM ChST Saturday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life-threatening swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Recent buoy and altimetry data showing the northerly swell coming in a bit higher than forecast and therefore expecting waves through the morning to be high enough for High Surf Warning, then decreasing this afternoon.
info.instruction: Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
